repo_info.name: yfinance
repo_info.description: Download market data from Yahoo! Finance's API

readme: # Download market data from Yahoo! Finance's API **yfinance** offers a Pythonic way to fetch financial & market data from [Yahoo!â“‡ finance](https://finance.yahoo.com). --- > [!IMPORTANT] > **Yahoo!, Y!Finance, and Yahoo! finance are registered trademarks of Yahoo, Inc.** > > yfinance is **not** affiliated, endorsed, or vetted by Yahoo, Inc. It's an open-source tool that uses Yahoo's publicly available APIs, and is intended for research and educational purposes. > > **You should refer to Yahoo!'s terms of use** ([here](https://policies.yahoo.com/us/en/yahoo/terms/product-atos/apiforydn/index.htm), [here](https://legal.yahoo.com/us/en/yahoo/terms/otos/index.html), and [here](https://policies.yahoo.com/us/en/yahoo/terms/index.htm)) **for details on your rights to use the actual data downloaded. > > Remember - the Yahoo! finance API is intended for personal use only.** --- > [!TIP] > THE NEW DOCUMENTATION WEBSITE IS NOW LIVE! ðŸ¤˜ > > Visit [**ranaroussi.github.io/yfinance**](https://ranaroussi.github.io/yfinance) --- ## Main components - `Ticker`: single ticker data - `Tickers`: multiple tickers' data - `download`: download market data for multiple tickers - `Market`: get information about a market - `WebSocket` and `AsyncWebSocket`: live streaming data - `Search`: quotes and news from search - `Sector` and `Industry`: sector and industry information - `EquityQuery` and `Screener`: build query to screen market ## Installation Install `yfinance` from PYPI using `pip`: ``` {.sourceCode .bash} $ pip install yfinance ``` ### [yfinance relies on the community to investigate bugs and contribute code. Here's how you can help.](https://github.com/ranaroussi/yfinance/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) --- ![Star History Chart](https://api.star-history.com/svg?repos=ranaroussi/yfinance) --- ### Legal Stuff **yfinance** is distributed under the **Apache Software License**. See the [LICENSE.txt](https://github.com/ranaroussi/yfinance/blob/main/LICENSE.txt) file in the release for details. AGAIN - yfinance is **not** affiliated, endorsed, or vetted by Yahoo, Inc. It's an open-source tool that uses Yahoo's publicly available APIs, and is intended for research and educational purposes. You should refer to Yahoo!'s terms of use ([here](https://policies.yahoo.com/us/en/yahoo/terms/product-atos/apiforydn/index.htm), [here](https://legal.yahoo.com/us/en/yahoo/terms/otos/index.html), and [here](https://policies.yahoo.com/us/en/yahoo/terms/index.htm)) for details on your rights to use the actual data downloaded. --- ### P.S. Please drop me a note with any feedback you have. **Ran Aroussi**

issues.title: [Bug] Failed to get ticker â€” fc.yahoo.com blocked by AdGuard (AdAway Default Blocklist)
issues.body:
### ðŸ§© Description

When using `yfinance`, I encountered repeated connection errors like the following:

```
Failed to get ticker '1605.T' reason: Failed to perform, curl: (7) Failed to connect to fc.yahoo.com port 443 after 2026 ms: Could not connect to server.
```

After some investigation, I found that this issue occurs **if you are using AdGuard (or other DNS-based blockers)**, because **the AdAway Default Blocklist includes `fc.yahoo.com`**, which is required by Yahoo Financeâ€™s API.

issues.title: Dividends data is really sum of dividends and Capital gain (incorrectly)
issues.body:
### Describe bug

The dividend column is incorrect. Specifically, dividend as reported by yahoo is the sum of dividends and capital gain distribution. As a result, the Adjusted Close data is also incorrect (because it adjusts the closing price based on the sum of dividends and capital gain). This introduces a first-order and significant error in adjusted close price.

Here is a simple code to verify this:

`import yfinance as yf

fund = yf.Ticker("VWILX")
data = fund.history(start="2025-12-01",

issues.title: Python 3.9 compatibility lost in 1.0
issues.body: ### Describe bug Importing yfinance fails on Python 3.9 due to runtime-evaluated type annotations in yfinance/calendars.py that use PEP 604 unions (|) together with builtin generics (list[...]). This raises a TypeError during class definition, preventing yfinance from importing. ### Simple code that reproduces your problem import yfinance as yf print("yfinance:", yf.__version__) df = yf.download("AAPL", period="5d", progress=False) print(df.tail())

issues.title: Internal cURL exception is exposed to users when a not-present ticker is requested
issues.body:
### Describe bug

YFinance internal exception `curl_cffi.requests.exceptions.HTTPError: HTTP Error 404` is thrown when a non-existing ticker is requested.

It should be abstracted under a common, documented behaviour how this situation is exposed to users and not expose internal workings (e.g. cURL backend).

### Simple code that reproduces your problem

```python
import yfinance as yf
stock = yf.Ticker('ABCDEFGHIJKLMONP')
stock.history(period="max")
```

issues.title: yf.Search() returns wrong symbol suffix .SG (Singapore) for Stuttgart exchange instruments
issues.body:
### Describe bug

When using yf.Search() with an ISIN, the API correctly identifies the exchange as STU (Stuttgart), but returns the symbol with suffix .SG which corresponds to Singapore Stock Exchange, not Stuttgart.

This causes subsequent yf.Ticker() calls to fail because the instrument doesn't exist on the Singapore exchange.

Simple Reproducible Example

``` python
import yfinance as yf

# Search for HANetf Future of Defence UCITS ETF
search = yf.Search("IE000OJ5TQP4")

# Check the first re

issues.title: Still "Too Many Requests" Error also in Version 0.2.62
issues.body:
### Describe bug

**Issue Description**
yfinance shows different behavior between interactive Python interpreter mode and script execution mode. In script mode, fetching stock information fails with a "Too Many Requests" error, while identical code works correctly in interactive mode.

###Root Cause
The problem originates in the _get_ticker_tz() function (in base.py) and its interaction with the caching system:
1.	In interactive mode, _fetch_ticker_tz() is called when a symbol is not in the cach

issues.title: Can you add the function to obtain overnight quote?
issues.body:
after midnight 12am, yahoo finance page https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/AAPL
can show the overnight quote of stock after the last day's close price. 

Can we add an api all to return this information?  e.g. via fast_info

issues.title: 1 Day Data is Broken
issues.body:
### Describe bug

It seems Yahoo Finance doesn't return 1 day data. I had to use 5 days data instead. I was fetching 82 tickers.

### Simple code that reproduces your problem

```
# BROKEN
yf.download(tickers=my_tickers, period="1d",  interval="1h", group_by="ticker")

# WORKS OK
yf.download(tickers=my_tickers, period="5d",  interval="1h", group_by="ticker")
```

### Debug log from yf.enable_debug_mode()

--

### Bad data proof

--

### `yfinance` version

latest

### Python version

_No respons

This is a major new release with some new features. The important summary is:
- optimised scraping (thanks @fredrik-corneliusson)
- financials tables match website (thanks @git-shogg
- price data improvements: fix NaN rows, new repair feature, metadata available (see README)

For full list of changes see the pre-release notes:
- [0.2.0rc1](https://github.com/ranaroussi/yfinance/releases/tag/0.2.0rc1)
